unnormalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Popcorn and Red Carpets, Yaar!
normalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Popcorn and Red Carpets, Friend!

unnormalised: So, you think film festivals are all about fancy outfits and posing for pictures, right? Nah, my friend. They're way more than that! Think of it as a Bollywood-level drama, but with more substance and less item numbers (okay, maybe sometimes there *are* item numbers, depending on the festival!).
normalised: So, you think film festivals are all about fancy outfits and posing for pictures, right? Nah, my friend. They're way more than that! Think of it as a Bollywood-level drama, but with more substance and less item numbers (okay, maybe sometimes there *are* item numbers, depending on the festival!).

unnormalised: I recently went to the Kolkata International Film Festival, and honestly, it blew my mind. Forget just seeing the usual suspects – you get a chance to discover films from all over the world, stuff you'd never find on Netflix or Amazon Prime. Independent films, documentaries, short films – a real smorgasbord of cinematic goodness.
normalised: I recently went to the Kolkata International Film Festival, and honestly, it blew my mind. Forget just seeing the usual suspects – you get a chance to discover films from all over the world, stuff you'd never find on Netflix or Amazon Prime. Independent films, documentaries, short films – a real smorgasbord of cinematic goodness.

unnormalised: It's also a fantastic place to bump into interesting people. I met a director from Kerala who was showcasing his first film, a poignant story about a small village dealing with environmental changes. We chatted for like, an hour near the Nandan complex. You just don't get that kind of connection scrolling through social media.

unnormalised: And it's not just for filmmakers and industry types. Film festivals are for anyone who loves stories told visually. They offer a different perspective, challenge your thinking, and introduce you to cultures and ideas you might never have encountered otherwise. Imagine watching a film from, say, Burkina Faso, and suddenly understanding something new about the human condition. Powerful stuff, right?

unnormalised: Of course, there's always the *tadka* of celebrity sightings. I saw a glimpse of, I swear it was, Bipasha Basu from like 50 Rs. distance away! Almost tripped trying to get a picture, haha.

unnormalised: Whether it's the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, the Mumbai Film Festival, or even smaller, more localized events, film festivals are totally worth checking out. Just be prepared to be inspired, challenged, and maybe even a little overwhelmed. Oh, and bring comfortable shoes. You'll be doing a lot of walking – especially if you want to grab some amazing street food in between screenings. Trust me, the momos near the Metro station were to die for, even if they were like 200 km away from my hotel. You might even discover the next *Lagaan* amongst the entries! Go on, give it a try!
